intro: Disakisperma dubium, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and a distinctive, spiny stem. Its flowers are inconspicuous, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants. Disakisperma dubium is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
